description:
The goal of the CODES project is use highly parallel simulation to explore the design of exascale 
storage architectures and distributed data-intensive science facilities. Our simulations build upon 
the Rensselaer Optimistic Simulation System (ROSS), a discrete event simulation framework that 
allows simulations to be run in parallel, decreasing the simulation run time of massive simulations 
to hours. We are using ROSS to explore topics including large-scale storage systems, I/O workloads, 
HPC network fabrics, distributed science systems, and data-intensive computation environments. The 
CODES project is a collaboration between the Mathematics and Computer Science department at Argonne National Laboratory and Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute.  We also collaborate with Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory for modeling HPC interconnect systems
name: CODES( CO-DESIGN OF EXASCALE STORAGE AND NETWORK ARCHITECTURES
